article.title: In Photos: Halloween festivities in Isla Vista washed away by rain
article.description: On Friday, any and all anticipation and fears of an Isla Vista Halloween of unprecedented rambunctiousness were washed away by heavy rain. One more day of Halloween weekend to go. Photo Credits: Anna ...
article.content:
On Friday, any and all anticipation and fears of an Isla Vista Halloween of unprecedented rambunctiousness were washed away by heavy rain.

One more day of Halloween weekend to go.

Photo Credits: Anna Kodelashvili, Will Tran

The torrential downpour of rain caught Halloween revelers with their pants down–in the case of this man, literally. Photo by Anna Kodelashvili

A man carries a hamper full of clothes (foreground) out of a beached sailboat on the shores of Isla Vista. Photo by Will Tran

Big branches of a tree fell near the restaurants of Pita Pit and Naan Stop between Trigo and Seville roads on Embarcadero del Mar. Photo by Anna Kodelashvili

A Bane casually strolls past a police barricade, apparently thirsty for some coke. Photo by Anna Kodelashvili

First aid stations were set up in Isla Vista to treat potential patients. Photo by Will Tran

There were few persons on the streets during the downpour on Friday. Del Playa Drive was so empty that police officers closed up the barricades blocking the street, allowing traffic to flow on the drive. Photo by Will Tran

Print

A cool team of photographers who preserves the visual memory of UCSB and Isla Vista.

related.title: In Photos: IV Around the World
related.description: Gauchos captured their favorite moments from summer travels, near and far, from right here in Isla Vista to exotic cities across continents.
related.content:
Gauchos captured their favorite moments from summer travels, near and far, from right here in Isla Vista to exotic cities across continents.

Third-year Taylor Daoust took a helicopter to the top of Fox Glacier while studying abroad in New Zealand with fellow Gauchos Audrey Berg and Amanda Schweitzer.

Third-year Maya Longtin captured hot steam rising from the Grand Prismatic Spring in Yellowstone National Park.

Fourth-year Rawan Sultan rode a camel and visited the ancient pyramids in Cairo, Egypt.

First-year Christine Choi ventured into Harry Potter World at Universal Studios Hollywood.

Fourth-year Brittany Tholan did marine research with a lab on campus and witnessed a couple of breathtaking, common dolphins right in our own backyard- just offshore of IV Reef.

Daily Nexus Photographer Stephen Manga jumped off a 22-foot cliff in Oahu, Hawaii.

Fourth-year Nate Fritter visited North Lake Tahoe with family.

News Editor Supriya Yelimeli spent a week in India for her cousin’s wedding. Pre-festivity market crawl in Bengaluru, India pictured.

Second-year Josephine Cheng reached the peak of the Sea to Sky Gondola overlooking Squamish River in Vancouver, Canada.

Third-year Kaitlyn Haberlin went hiking around Silver Lake in the Eastern Sierras.

related.title: This Week in Photos: Oct. 7 – 12
related.description: We look back at this past week in photos. Credits: John Clow, Eric Swenson, Kenneth Song, Christine Skari
related.content:
We look back at this past week in photos.

Credits: John Clow, Eric Swenson, Kenneth Song, Christine Skari

UCSB Professor and recent Nobel Prize winner Shuji Nakamura speaks with the media after a press conference on October 7, 2014. Nakamura, who said he was awaken early that morning to news he had won the Nobel Prize for his invention of efficient blue light-emitting diodes, is the sixth UCSB faculty member to receive the honor since 1998. John Clow/Daily Nexus

Performers of Schoolhouse Rock go airborne during a performance in Campbell Hall on Sunday. The musical play, which is based on the iconic cartoon series, brought audiences down memory lane with classic songs such as “Conjunction Junction”, “Just a Bill”, “Three is a Magic Number”, and “Interplanet Jane”.  Eric Swenson/Daily Nexus

UCSB’s Tobias Galskov hits an approach shot against Cal’s JT Nishimura in at the UCSB Classic on Sunday. Galskov prevailed over Nishimura 6-4, 6-3 to take third place in Flight A singles. The Gauchos will compete at the ITA Regionals this Friday at Malibu. Kenneth Song/Daily Nexus

Participants of UCSB Larping Battle engage in a large-scale melee at Dogshit Park on Sunday. The LARPING (“Live-Action-Role-Playing”) consisted of two “armies” engaging in hand-to-hand combat much like the close-quarter battles of the Medieval Ages. To ensure fair gameplay, rules were enforced, such as no magic or headshots. Christine Skari/Daily Nexus

Lorde sings in a sold-out show at the Santa Barbara Bowl last Thursday. The wildly popular New Zealand singer-songwriter performed every single song from her sole album Pure Heroine, plus a a brand new song from the soundtrack of the Hunger Games: Mockingjay – Part 1.  Kenneth Song/Daily Nexus

Singer and UCSB alum Jack Johnson held a surprise performance with Animal Liberation Orchestra at Storke Plaza on Wednesday. Johnson and the ALO were part of a commemoration the honored Isla Vista shooting victims and promoted a safer, healthier UCSB and Isla Vista. Kenneth Song/Daily Nexus

Word of Jack Johnson’s presence spread like wildfire in the afternoon before his performance, and students flooded Storke Plaza by the thousands at the commemoration. Kenneth Song/Daily Nexus

related.title: In Photos: Santa Barbara and Seafood Festival 2016
related.description: Last Saturday, the Santa Barbara Harbor and Seafood Festival took place in downtown SB. The harbor was packed with people wanting to get a taste of locally caught and freshly prepared seafood. Along w...
related.content:
Last Saturday, the Santa Barbara Harbor and Seafood Festival took place in downtown SB. The harbor was packed with people wanting to get a taste of locally caught and freshly prepared seafood. Along with getting to meet fisherman face to face and experiencing an enriching day of activities and events that provide insight into the prominent food industry of Santa Barbara, guests are entertained with live music, artisan shopping and, of course, delicious food.

Photos by Jenny Luo

People gathered to partake in the authentic harbor cuisine. Jenny Luo / Daily Nexus
A sea urchin displaying its inner worth. Jenny Luo / Daily Nexus
Crustaceous creatures were in plenty at the festival. Jenny Luo / Daily Nexus

Nothing quite sets the beach vibe like a pineapple cup. Jenny Luo / Daily Nexus
Seafood seared and sizzled to perfection. Jenny Luo / Daily Nexus
Micro tulips pack a punch of color. Jenny Luo / Daily Nexus

Even the kids know the seafood festival is the place to be. Jenny Luo / Daily Nexus
Festival-goers browse the various vendors. Jenny Luo / Daily Nexus
A token to remember this blessed day. Jenny Luo / Daily Nexus

Lobster rolls and chips. Jenny Luo / Daily Nexus
What festival would be complete without live music to create the atmosphere? Jenny Luo / Daily Nexus
An aphrodisiac for some, a delicious appetizer for everyone. Jenny Luo / Daily Nexus
